text: Philip Hughes was the embodiment of the
australian batsman a breed for whom
graft is as important as craft the quiet
country boy from New South Wales was
Park cricketer part fighter as a batsman
Hughes had guts if not always grace the
81 he made in a losing cause in the
first test of last year's Ash's
demonstrated his character he began his
career by becoming the youngest man to
score a century in both innings of a
Test match but his form was patchy and
he found himself in and out of the
Australia team Hughes worked on his game
in England playing for Middlesex
Hampshire and Worcestershire he was
popular in County cricket he was my
first son and was military his MD of
cricket cracking young man very popular
full of energy bit of mischief about him
put a huge trail iya against his former
state's New South Wales in a Sheffield
Shield match when he was struck on the
head by a delivery from Shawn Abbott he
was taken to hospital but despite
surgery succumbed his injury still in
his mid-20s Phillip Hughes would surely
have played for Australia many times in
the years to come it is a great tragedy
for his country and his sport that he
leaves his crease far too early
you
